scenarioDescription:
The K2-85 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-85 is a star with 0.57 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.51 times its radius. It is located 317.08 light years away from the solar system.

K2-85 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-85 system


K2-85 b

K2-85 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2016-09, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.01 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-85 b is 1.008 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-85 b is 1.010 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, K2-85 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-85, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-85 - System With 1 Exoplanet
